## Description {#details}

This contains a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineschedstrategy">MachineSchedStrategy</a> implementation for maximizing wave occupancy on GCN hardware.

This pass will apply multiple scheduling stages to the same function. Regions are first recorded in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnscheduledagmilive/#a3c1701146006f98eaa57e38932060160">GCNScheduleDAGMILive::schedule</a>. The actual entry point for the scheduling of those regions is GCNScheduleDAGMILive::runSchedStages.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### canUsePressureDiffs() {#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool canUsePressureDiffs (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &amp; SU)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Checks whether <code>SU</code> can use the cached DAG pressure diffs to compute the current register pressure.

This works for the common case, but it has a few exceptions that have been observed through trial and error:
<ul>
<li>Explicit physical register operands</li>
<li>Subregister definitions</li>
</ul>


In both of those cases, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a> doesn&#39;t represent the actual pressure, and querying <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a> through the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regpressuretracker">RegPressureTracker</a> is needed to get an accurate value.

We should eventually only use <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a> for maximum performance, but this already allows 80% of SUs to take the fast path without changing scheduling at all. Further changes would either change scheduling, or require a lot more logic to recover an accurate pressure estimate from the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediffs">PressureDiffs</a>.

Definition at line <a href="#l00141">141</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp">GCNSchedStrategy.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Defines

### DEBUG&#95;TYPE {#ad78e062f62e0d6e453941fb4ca843e4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>#define DEBUG&#95;TYPE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;machine-scheduler&quot;</>}>
Generally, the reason for having multiple scheduling stages is to account for the kernel-wide effect of register usage on occupancy.

Usually, only a few scheduling regions will have register pressure high enough to limit occupancy for the kernel, so constraints can be relaxed to improve ILP in other regions.

Definition at line <a href="#l00031">31</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp">GCNSchedStrategy.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;VGPRCriticalLimit = &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a87648a3c33abb5fb8ff110b760424ecc">VGPRCriticalLimit</a></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">                    &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;, SGPRCriticalLimit = &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a2ed3b8acc5fc8c2f5c155620b5c32555">SGPRCriticalLimit</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">                    &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;, SGPRExcessLimit = &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aa8793c7d097d298c1590b67980054d8b">SGPRExcessLimit</a> &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;\\n\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Checks whether \\p SU can use the cached DAG pressure diffs to compute the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">/// current register pressure.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This works for the common case, but it has a few exceptions that have been</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// observed through trial and error:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - Explicit physical register operands</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">///   - Subregister definitions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In both of those cases, PressureDiff doesn&#39;t represent the actual pressure,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and querying LiveIntervals through the RegPressureTracker is needed to get</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">/// an accurate value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We should eventually only use PressureDiff for maximum performance, but this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">/// already allows 80% of SUs to take the fast path without changing scheduling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">/// at all. Further changes would either change scheduling, or require a lot</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">/// more logic to recover an accurate pressure estimate from the PressureDiffs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141" lineLink="#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750">canUsePressureDiffs</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &amp;SU) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewSGPRPressure = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#ab169c359dc2328b0a4e93f5f95b82fc0">Pressure</a>&#91;AMDGPU::RegisterPressureSets::SReg&#95;32&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewVGPRPressure = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#ab169c359dc2328b0a4e93f5f95b82fc0">Pressure</a>&#91;AMDGPU::RegisterPressureSets::VGPR&#95;32&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If two instructions increase the pressure of different register sets</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by the same amount, the generic scheduler will prefer to schedule the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction that increases the set with the least amount of registers,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which in our case would be SGPRs.  This is rarely what we want, so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when we report excess/critical register pressure, we do it either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only for VGPRs or only for SGPRs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: Better heuristics to determine whether to prefer SGPRs or VGPRs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxVGPRPressureInc = 16;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ShouldTrackVGPRs = VGPRPressure + MaxVGPRPressureInc &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ShouldTrackSGPRs = !ShouldTrackVGPRs &amp;&amp; SGPRPressure &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aa8793c7d097d298c1590b67980054d8b">SGPRExcessLimit</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: We have to enter REG-EXCESS before we reach the actual threshold</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to increase the likelihood we don&#39;t go over the limits.  We should improve</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the analysis to look through dependencies to find the path with the least</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// register pressure.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We only need to update the RPDelta for instructions that increase register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pressure. Instructions that decrease or keep reg pressure the same will be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// marked as RegExcess in tryCandidate() when they are compared with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions that increase the register pressure.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ShouldTrackVGPRs &amp;&amp; NewVGPRPressure &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy tries best to clause memory instructions as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><Highlight kind="comment">/// much as possible. This is achieved by:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  1 Prioritize clustered operations before stall latency heuristic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  2 Prioritize long-latency-load before stall latency heuristic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param Cand provides the policy and current best candidate.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param TryCand refers to the next SUnit candidate, otherwise uninitialized.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\param Zone describes the scheduled zone that we are extending, or nullptr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="comment">///             if Cand is from a different zone than TryCand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\return \\c true if TryCand is better than Cand (Reason is NOT NoCand)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnmaxmemoryclauseschedstrategy/#a9eba23f1b8a103c8e88a2ca6227d97b3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnmaxmemoryclauseschedstrategy/#a9eba23f1b8a103c8e88a2ca6227d97b3">GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy::tryCandidate</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp;Cand,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the block has the only successor then live-ins of that successor are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// live-outs of the current block. We can reuse calculated live set if the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// successor will be sent to scheduling past current block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, due to the bug in LiveInterval analysis it may happen that two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predecessors of the same successor block have different lane bitmasks for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a live-out register. Workaround that by sticking to one-to-one relationship</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// i.e. one predecessor with one successor block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MachineBasicBlock &#42;OnlySucc = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a81626de817a0cb021ff8e915cf1942ed">succ&#95;size</a>() == 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Candidate = &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a6321b189ea8fd5058663f8a87d6c23e9">succ&#95;begin</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Candidate-&gt;empty() &amp;&amp; Candidate-&gt;pred&#95;size() == 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="normal">      SlotIndexes &#42;Ind = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledagmi/#a9d67b1cafa36e90d7060d1da84907885">LIS</a>-&gt;getSlotIndexes();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Ind-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindexes/#aaf0c07cc1cdb9c78c6dfdfdd5913420a">getMBBStartIdx</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>) &lt; Ind-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/slotindexes/#aaf0c07cc1cdb9c78c6dfdfdd5913420a">getMBBStartIdx</a>(Candidate))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">        OnlySucc = Candidate;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1266"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a7b1949efaeff587aabe24ae6865f9e1e">DAG</a>.RegionsWithMinOcc&#91;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#aa7ee003eb6297edeab5ac83fb99711a0">RegionIdx</a>&#93; =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1267"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a935e3a2cbb8d260bc1cc4dcf701db0ec">PressureAfter</a>.getOccupancy(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>) == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a7b1949efaeff587aabe24ae6865f9e1e">DAG</a>.MinOccupancy;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1268"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1269"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Early out if we have achieved the occupancy target.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1270"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Pressure in desired limits, done.\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1271"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1272"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1273"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1274"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TargetOccupancy = std::min(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1275"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a2f14a5fe09608fc5cce9e68e4f516a68">S</a>.getTargetOccupancy(), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>.getOccupancyWithWorkGroupSizes(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a979d350534fac63dad98d8f2937bf5a7">MF</a>).second);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1276"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WavesAfter =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1277"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::min(TargetOccupancy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a935e3a2cbb8d260bc1cc4dcf701db0ec">PressureAfter</a>.getOccupancy(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1278"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WavesBefore =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1279"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::min(TargetOccupancy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a30bb50e213057f1830b72558972019fa">PressureBefore</a>.getOccupancy(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1280"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Occupancy before scheduling: &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; WavesBefore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1281"><Highlight kind="normal">                    &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;, after &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; WavesAfter &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;.\\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1282"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1283"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We may not be able to keep the current target occupancy because of the just</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1284"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scheduled region. We might still be able to revert scheduling if the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1285"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// occupancy before was higher, or if the current schedule has register</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pressure higher than the excess limits which could lead to more spilling.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NewOccupancy = std::max(WavesAfter, WavesBefore);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1289"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Allow memory bound functions to drop to 4 waves if not limited by an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
